availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harvey R. Bourland (Hopkins co., KY, farmer and pvt 10 ky cav (CSA))

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Farm laborer for Alvin Fowler in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as private from September 6, 1862. Captured at Cheshire, Ohio, on June 20, 1863. Prisoner of war at Camp Chase, Ohio; Camp Douglas, Illinois; and Point Lookout, Maryland, until February 11, 1865. Residence reported at McCracken County, Kentucky, upon release.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 704.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0052.
"Harvey Rice Bourland (1840-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial #67608591, accessed June 24, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/67608591.
